results.title: Integration: a place for everyone
results.brief_description: Presents an overview of the integration process at work. Indicates parents’ desires for their disabled children at school. Stresses necessity of support group between school and family and classroom modifications for successful integration. Highlights educational and social benefits for the dissabled child.

results.title: Instant arson: testing firebombs and incendiaries
results.brief_description: Discusses the effects of arson with firebombs and chemical incendiaries as ignition sources, and demonstrates different methods of extinguishing the resulting fire.

results.title: Insight: exit
results.creator_credit: Jack Shea and John Furia Jr
results.brief_description: A dramatisation about a college senior who drops out of school and embraces the drug culture. The story follows: Peter and Mary are in love and Peter is forming a peace march whereupon he is arrested and one of his friends is killed. After this experience, Peter joins a “hippie” group who experiment in all types of drugs. Mary tries to get Peter away from drugs and those influencing him, but to no avail. As one of Peter’s friends nearly overdoses, Peter manages to save her and takes her to hospital where the Doctor tries to explain the dangers of drug taking. This film is used to explore the drug syndrome and show the futility of using narcotics. Written by John W. Zodrow.

results.title: Insight: director
results.brief_description: A fascinating “Profile” of a film director in which Anthony Asquith talks about his career going back to the days of the silent cinema; cutting, editing and finally directing; the setting up and shooting of a scene from a recent production; excerpts from his earlier works including “Tell England”. Mastery of the art and a sympathetic understanding of players are essential for quality productions. Includes interviews with Dirk Bogarde, Olivia de Havilland and Paul Massey.

results.title: Inside Australia's Parliament House
results.creator_credit: Craig Chapman, Bill Bowtell and Entertainment Incorporated
results.brief_description: Ita Buttrose takes you behind the scenes into the private and public areas of the magnificent Parliament House. With the help of four Australian Prime Ministers and the building’s creator, Aldo Giurgola, you will be guided with an insight that’s entertaining, intimate and totally fascinating. You are shown the Prime Minister’s office and private courtyard; Cabinet rooms; Hi-tech banquet kitchens; Parliamentarians’ offices; Great Hall; Members’ Hall; Chambers of Senate and House of Representatives, plus the vast offering of paintings, ceramics, sculpture, mosaics, stained glass, tapestries, special gifts from many nations; and more. Narrated by George Negus.

results.title: Insan = Human being
results.creator_credit: Ibrahim Shaddad and S C Cinema
results.brief_description: This experimental film without dialogue makes innovative use of sound to tell the story of a shepherd who, having lost his wife, children and cattle after his homeland is stricken by drought, goes to the city to find work. Through a poetic association of images the film critiques the dehumanising effects on the Sudanese people of the Sharia ruled government that was in power in the early eighties.

results.title: Technics
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Microcosms of the Mouth”
Describes and demonstrates the development of new methods for study of the microbial masses adhering to the teeth and soft tissues in the mouth.

results.title: Role in periodontal disease
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Microcosms of the Mouth”.
An inside view of microbial community and their inhabitants and the role in inception and progression of periodontal disease. Know the cause and take preventative measures.
